snippet: Bernard Jordan became known as the “Great Escaper” after he disappeared from his nursing home and caught a ferry to France to attend the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of D-Day.
abstract: Bernard Jordan, British veteran of World War II who walked away from nursing home in England to attend celebrations of 70th anniversay of D-Day in France, dies at age 90; he became known as the Great Escaper after his adventure in June 2014, and returned to home a quasi-hero.
lead_paragraph: Bernard Jordan became known as the “Great Escaper” after he disappeared from his nursing home and caught a ferry to France to attend the celebrations of the 70th anniversary of D-Day.

headline.main: A Veteran Who Captured Imaginations on D-Day Anniversary Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: A Veteran Who Captured Imaginations Dies at 90
